title: 113_s784
content: The "Agricultural Opportunities for Military Veterans Act" amends the Agricultural Risk Protection Act of 2000 to include veteran farmers or ranchers in the Value-Added Agricultural Market Development Program Grants. The amendment also changes the year from 2012 to 2017 in paragraph 7(B). The Agricultural Opportunities for Military Veterans Act includes outreach and assistance for socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers, as well as veteran farmers and ranchers. The Agricultural Opportunities for Military Veterans Act includes amendments to provide outreach and assistance for socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers, as well as veteran farmers and ranchers. The Agricultural Opportunities for Military Veterans Act includes amendments to provide outreach and assistance for socially disadvantaged farmers and ranchers, as well as veteran farmers and ranchers. The amendments include authorization of appropriations totaling $20,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2013 to 2017, with an additional $5,000,000 allocated for each of those years specifically for veteran farmers and ranchers. Additionally, the amendments expand eligibility to include veteran farmers and ranchers in subsection (b)(2). The definition of "veteran farmer or rancher" is amended to include individuals who served in the military and were discharged under conditions other than dishonorable. The Beginning Farmer and Rancher Development Program is established under the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include beginning farmers and ranchers who are veterans. State grants are defined for eligible entities as agencies of a State or political subdivision. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include grants for farm safety programs at the local level, with eligibility for States and agricultural organizations. The Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002 is amended to include grants for farm safety programs at the local level, with eligibility for States and agricultural organizations. Amendments include allocating $17,000,000 for each fiscal year from 2013 to 2017, remaining available until expended. SEC. 5. MILITARY VETERANS AGRICULTURAL LIAISON. This section adds a new provision for a Military Veterans Agricultural Liaison within the Department of Agriculture. The Secretary will establish the position of Military Veterans Agricultural Liaison in the Department of Agriculture. The liaison will provide information and connect returning veterans with agricultural training programs, assist in using veterans educational benefits for farming careers, and serve as a resource for veteran farmers. The Military Veterans Agricultural Liaison will assist veteran farmers and ranchers in applying for agricultural programs and advocate for veterans in interactions with Department employees. They may enter contracts for research, educational materials, workshops, vocational training, and mentoring activities. The Department of Agriculture will establish the position of Military Veterans Agricultural Liaison to assist veteran farmers and ranchers in accessing agricultural programs and advocating for them. SEC. 6. Amends the Conservation Reserve Program Transition Incentive Program to include veteran farmers or ranchers and authorizes $50,000,000 for fiscal years 2013 through 2017. SEC. 7. Addresses the Environmental Quality Incentives Program. SEC. 7 amends the Environmental Quality Incentives Program to include veteran farmers or ranchers. SEC. 8 reserves funds to assist certain farmers or ranchers with conservation access. Section 1241(g) of the Food Security Act of 1985 is amended to give preference to veteran farmers or ranchers in providing assistance. Section 1244(a)(2) is also amended to include veteran farmers or ranchers in conservation programs.
